azurerm_data_factory_integration_runtime.description: Manages an Azure Data Factory Managed Integration Runtime.

name.description: Specifies the name of the Managed Integration Runtime. Changing this forces a new resource to be created. Must be globally unique. See the [Microsoft documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/data-factory/naming-rules

data_factory_name.description: Specifies the name of the Data Factory the Managed Integration Runtime belongs to. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

resource_group_name.description: The name of the resource group in which to create the Managed Integration Runtime. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

location.description: Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

node_size.description: The size of the nodes on which the Managed Integration Runtime runs. Valid values are: `Standard_D2_v3`, `Standard_D4_v3`, `Standard_D8_v3`, `Standard_D16_v3`, `Standard_D32_v3`, `Standard_D64_v3`, `Standard_E2_v3`, `Standard_E4_v3`, `Standard_E8_v3`, `Standard_E16_v3`, `Standard_E32_v3`, `Standard_E64_v3`, `Standard_D1_v2`, `Standard_D2_v2`, `Standard_D3_v2`, `Standard_D4_v2`, `Standard_A4_v2` and `Standard_A8_v2`

number_of_nodes.description: Number of nodes for the Managed Integration Runtime. Max is `10`. Defaults to `1`.

max_parallel_executions_per_node.description: Defines the maximum parallel executions per node. Defaults to `1`. Max is `16`.

edition.description: The Managed Integration Runtime edition. Valid values are `Standard` and `Enterprise`. Defaults to `Standard`.

license_type.description: The type of the license that is used. Valid values are `LicenseIncluded` and `BasePrize`. Defaults to `LicenseIncluded`.

server_endpoint.description: The endpoint of an Azure SQL Server that will be used to host the SSIS catalog.

administrator_login.description: Administrator login name for the SQL Server.

administrator_password.description: Administrator login password for the SQL Server.

pricing_tier.description: Pricing tier for the database that will be created for the SSIS catalog. Valid values are: `Basic`, `Standard`, `Premium` and `PremiumRS`.

blob_container_uri.description: The blob endpoint for the container which contains a custom setup script that will be run on every node on startup. See [https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/data-factory/how-to-configure-azure-ssis-ir-custom-setup](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/data-factory/how-to-configure-azure-ssis-ir-custom-setup

sas_token.description: A container SAS token that gives access to the files. See [https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/data-factory/how-to-configure-azure-ssis-ir-custom-setup](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/data-factory/how-to-configure-azure-ssis-ir-custom-setup

vnet_id.description: ID of the virtual network to which the nodes of the Managed Integration Runtime will be added.

subnet_name.description: Name of the subnet to which the nodes of the Managed Integration Runtime will be added.

id.description: The ID of the Data Factory Integration Managed Runtime.

create.description: Used when creating the Data Factory Integration Managed Runtime.

update.description: Used when updating the Data Factory Integration Managed Runtime.

read.description: Used when retrieving the Data Factory Integration Managed Runtime.

delete.description: Used when deleting the Data Factory Integration Managed Runtime.
